document.docAuthor: Niu, Ze-Qing, Ascher, John S., Luo, A-Rong, Griswold, Terry & Zhu, Chao-Dong
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Anthidiellum Cockerell, 1904 of China (Hymenoptera, Apoidea, Megachilidae, Anthidiini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Anthidiellum Cockerell, 1904 of China (Hymenoptera, Apoidea, Megachilidae, Anthidiini)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Chinese species of
Anthidiellum

paragraph.keyLead:
3 . Omaular carina with a shallow concavity on upper margin (
Figs. 2
f, 3 f); scutellum with posterior margin distinctly angled inward to midpoint (
Fig. 3
d); paraocular area with yellow maculation extending above antennal socket (
Fig. 3
b).......... 4

-. Omaular carina straight, without a shallow concavity on upper margin (
Fig. 5
f); scutellum with posterior margin broadly rounded outward except for narrow, shallow notch medially (
Fig. 5
d); paraocular area with yellow maculation not extending above antennal socket (
Fig. 5
b)..................................
Anthidiellum ( Anthidiellum ) yunnanense (
Wu, 1962
)

4 . Apical margin of T 6 with well-developed lateral lobe in addition to medial spike (
Fig. 3
g); T 2 coarsely punctate (
Fig. 3
e)...............................................................
Anthidiellum ( Anthidiellum ) scutellatum Wu, 2004

-. Apical margin of T 6 with medial spike but without lateral lobe; T 2 finely punctate (
Fig. 2
e)..........................................................................................
Anthidiellum ( Anthidiellum ) boreale Wu, 2004

5 . Hind tibia with longitudinal carina on outer face; T 2 black, without yellow maculation laterally (
Fig. 8
e); axilla yellow (
Fig. 8
d).......................................................
Anthidiellum ( Pycnanthidium ) carinatum (
Wu, 1962
)

-. Hind tibia without longitudinal carina on outer face; T 2 with yellow maculation laterally (
Fig. 11
e); axilla black (
Fig. 11
d)..........................................................
Anthidiellum ( Pycnanthidium ) latipes (
Bingham, 1897
)

6 . Hind tibia and hind basitarsus each with a longitudinal carina on outer face (
Fig. 7
f); mandible with three teeth (
Fig. 7
c)..............................................................
Anthidiellum ( Pycnanthidium ) carinatum (
Wu, 1962
)

-. Hind tibia and hind basitarsus both without a longitudinal carina on outer face (
Figs. 4
f, 9 f); mandible with four teeth, though third tooth sometimes very small (
Figs. 1
c, 4 c, 6 c, 9 c)........................................................ 7

7 . Hind basitarsus stout (
Figs. 9
f, 10 f), width as wide as greatest width of hind tibia.................................. 8

-. Hind basitarsus slender (
Fig. 6
a), width much less than greatest width of hind tibia................................. 9

8 . Posterior margin of scutellum black (
Fig. 10
d)....................
Anthidiellum ( Pycnanthidium ) latipes (
Bingham, 1897
)

-. Posterior margin of scutellum yellow, with two yellow markings (
Fig. 9
d)....................................................................................................
Anthidiellum ( Pycnanthidium ) coronum (Wu, 2004 )

9 . Forewing with veins bicolored, basally dark and distally yellow including stigma (
Fig. 6
e); mandible much broader apically than basally (
Fig. 6
c); T 1 -T 3 black, without yellow maculation (
Fig. 6
e)..
Anthidiellum ( Clypanthidium ) popovii (
Wu, 1962
)

-. Forewing with veins all dark (
Fig. 1
a); mandible scarcely broader apically than basally; at least T 2 -T 3 with yellow maculations laterally (
Fig. 1
e, 4 e)................................................................................. 10

10 . Omaular carina with shallow concavity on upper margin (
Fig. 1
f); scutellum with posterior margin distinctly angled inward to midpoint (
Fig. 1
d); paraocular area with yellow maculation (
Fig. 1
b).......
Anthidiellum ( Anthidiellum ) boreale Wu, 2004

-. Omaular carina straight, without a shallow concavity on upper margin (
Fig. 4
f); scutellum with posterior margin broadly rounded outward except for narrow, shallow notch medially (
Fig. 4
d); paraocular area black, without yellow maculation (
Fig. 4
b)........................................................
Anthidiellum ( Anthidiellum ) yunnanense (
Wu, 1962
)
